content:
H2DMPMB (0.111 g, 0.30 mmol) was dissolved in 15 mL of dimethylformamide in a high-pressure glass tube; Co(NO3)2·6H2O (0.087 g, 0.30 mmol) was then added. The violet suspension formed was left under stirring at 130 °C for 24 h. The violet precipitate obtained was filtered off, washed twice with methanol, and then dried in vacuo. Yield: 88%. [Co(DMPMB)] is insoluble in alcohols, dimethyl sulfoxide, acetone, acetonitrile, dimethylformamide, and water. IR (cm–1): 3100–3000(vw) ν(C–Haromatic), 3000–2800(m) ν(CH3, CH2), 1504(s) ν(CC+CN). Elemental analysis calc. for C24H24CoN4 (FW = 427.41 g/mol): C, 67.44; H, 5.66; N, 13.11%. Found: C, 67.02; H, 5.63; N, 12.65%. Alternatively, compound [Co(DMPMB)] could be obtained by using cobalt(II) acetate as the source of metal ions.

Synthesis of <bold>[Zn(DMPMB)]</bold>

H2DMPMB (0.111 g, 0.30 mmol) was dissolved in 15 mL of dimethylformamide in a high-pressure glass tube; then, Zn(NO3)2·6H2O (0.089 g, 0.30 mmol) was added. The white suspension formed was left under stirring at 130 °C for 24 h. The white precipitate obtained was filtered off, washed twice with methanol, and then dried in vacuo. Yield: 75%. 1 is insoluble in alcohols, dimethyl sulfoxide, acetone, acetonitrile, dimethylformamide and water. IR (cm–1): 3100–3000(vw) ν(C–Haromatic), 3000–2800(m) ν(CH3, CH2), 1508(s) ν(CC+CN). Elemental analysis calc. for C24H24N4Zn (FW = 433.86 g/mol): C, 66.44; H, 5.58; N, 12.91%. Found: C, 65.93; H, 5.58; N, 12.70%. Alternatively, compound [Zn(DMPMB)] could be obtained by using zinc(II) acetate as the source of metal ions.

Synthesis of <bold>[Cd(DMPMB)]</bold>

H2DMPMB (0.111 g, 0.30 mmol) was dissolved in 15 mL of dimethylformamide in a high-pressure glass tube; Cd(NO3)2·4H2O (0.092 g, 0.30 mmol) was then added, and the suspension was stirred at 130 °C for 24 h. The white precipitate obtained was filtered off, washed twice with methanol, and then dried in vacuo. Yield: 85%. [Cd(DMPMB)] is insoluble in alcohols, dimethyl sulfoxide, acetone, acetonitrile, dimethylformamide and water. IR (cm–1): 3100–3000(vw) ν(C–Haromatic), 3000–2800(m) ν(CH3, CH2), 1504(s) ν(CC+CN). Elemental analysis calc. for C24H24CdN4 (FW = 480.89 g/mol): C, 59.94; H, 5.03; N, 11.65%. Found: C, 59.56; H, 4.99; N, 11.40%. Alternatively, compound [Cd(DMPMB)] could be obtained by using cadmium(II) acetate as the source of metal ions.

Synthesis of <bold>[Cu</bold> <sub> <bold>2</bold> </sub> <bold>(DMPMB)]</bold>

H2DMPMB (0.111 g, 0.30 mmol) was dissolved in 15 mL of dimethylformamide in a high-pressure glass tube; Cu(NO3)2·2.5H2O (0.070 g, 0.30 mmol) was then added. A green suspension was immediately formed, which was left under stirring at 130 °C for 24 h. The color of the suspension turned progressively from green to white. The white precipitate formed was filtered off, washed twice with methanol, and then dried in vacuo. Yield: 65%. [Cu 2 (DMPMB)] is insoluble in alcohols, dimethyl sulfoxide, acetone, acetonitrile, dimethylformamide and water. IR (cm–1): 3100–3000(vw) ν(C–Haromatic), 3000–2800(m) ν(CH3, CH2), 1510(s) ν(CC+CN). Elemental analysis calc. for C24H24Cu2N4 (FW = 495.57 g/mol): C, 58.17; H, 4.88; N, 11.31%. Found: C, 58.01; H, 4.91; N, 10.94%. Alternatively, compound [Cu 2 (DMPMB)] could be obtained by using copper(II) acetate as the source of metal ions.

Synthesis of <bold>[Ag</bold> <sub> <bold>2</bold> </sub> <bold>(DMPMB)]</bold>

H2DMPMB (92.6 mg, 0.25 mmol) was dissolved in 30 mL of methanol; separately, AgCl (71.75 mg, 0.50 mmol) was dissolved in 30 mL of an aqueous solution of ammonia (30%) under gentle warming; the resulting limpid solution was added to the first one by means of a dropping funnel. The white suspension that was immediately formed was left under stirring at room temperature for 2 h. Then, the white precipitate was filtered off, washed twice with methanol, and dried in vacuo. Yield: 69%. [Ag 2 (DMPMB)] is insoluble in alcohols, dimethyl sulfoxide, acetone, acetonitrile, dimethylformamide, and water. IR (cm–1): 3100–3000(vw) ν(C–Haromatic), 3000–2800(m) ν(CH3, CH2), 1498(s) ν(CC+CN). Elemental analysis calc. for C24H24Ag2N4 (FW = 584.22 g/mol): C, 49.34; H, 4.14; N, 9.59%. Found: C, 49.78; H, 4.35; N, 9.92%.

Alternatively, compound [Ag 2 (DMPMB)] could be obtained through the addition of a hot water solution (10 mL) of silver(I) acetate (0.084 g, 0.50 mol) to a methanolic solution (20 mL) containing the ligand (0.093 g, 0.25 mol); after 2 h of stirring at room temperature, the addition of solid ammonium acetate (0.077 g, 1.00 mol) afforded [Ag 2 (DMPMB)] as a white precipitate.

Synthesis of [Co(DMPMB)] 

H2DMPMB (0.111 g, 0.30 mmol) was dissolved in 15 mL of dimethylformamide in a high-pressure glass tube; Co(NO3)2⋅6H2O (0.087 g, 0.30 mmol) was then added. The violet suspension formed was left under stirring at 130 °C for 24 h. The violet precipitate obtained was filtered off, washed twice with methanol, and then dried in vacuo. Yield: 88%. [Co(DMPMB)] is insoluble in alcohols, dimethyl sulfoxide, acetone, acetonitrile, dimethylformamide, and water. IR (cm-1): 3100-3000(vw) ν(C-Haromatic), 3000-2800(m) ν(CH3, CH2), 1504(s) ν(CC+CN). Elemental analysis calc. for C24H24CoN4 (FW = 427.41 g/mol): C, 67.44; H, 5.66; N, 13.11%. Found: C, 67.02; H, 5.63; N, 12.65%. Alternatively, compound [Co(DMPMB)] could be obtained by using cobalt(II) acetate as the source of metal ions.
